page.title: 02LEIGHTERTON VILLAGE
page.content: Leighterton is a tiny village which lies just to the east of the A46 Stroud - Bath road. It is part of the parish of Boxwell. It has been described as "a knot of stone barns and cottages among a tangled skein of lanes". The village is built round the 14th century church (restored in 1877) and the Royal Oak, "more likely a village pub than many in Cotswold." Most of the inhbitants are retired, a few work on the scattered farms or else they commute to Tetbury or Bristol. There are 86 on the present roll of electors. What little social life there is, is centered on the pub, the church and the small village primary school. Many of the school children are bought in by bus from the area.
